body:
## Overview

* [Form Builder: What it is](/what-it-is)
* [Form Builder overview video]( https://youtu.be/zGU_FoBQh-Q)
* [How Form Builder uses JSON (javascript object notation)](/how-uses-json)
* [How Form Builder handles users’ data](/how-handles-data)
* [Using Form Builder: what you’ll need](/what-youll-need)

## GOV.UK Design system
In Form Builder, users can build forms compatible to the GOV.UK design system. To find out what the different page types, patterns and components are, you can follow the below links.
* [GOV.UK Design system](https://design-system.service.gov.uk/)
* [GOV.UK Design components](https://design-system.service.gov.uk/components/)
* [GOV.UK Design Patterns](https://design-system.service.gov.uk/patterns/)

## Where are my files located?
All the files generated through Form Builder are stored in your local directory, Documents> formbuilder>forms

## GitHub
You will need to commit your changes to GitHub. Once you have done that, you will need to go to the Github and grab the web URL (Clone with HTTP). This link needs to be entered in the [fb-publisher](https://github.com/ministryofjustice/fb-publisher) in order to deploy your form.

## Tips
* All forms need to have three types of pages: 1) A start page (already added) 2) A Check yours answers page 3)  A confirmation page 
* Don't use space for Form name when creating a new form
* Don't use space when entering values
* You can use [markdown](https://www.gov.uk/guidance/how-to-publish-on-gov-uk/markdown) to format your content, e.g. add bullet
heading: Form Builder user guide
